question.title: Flu is spread via social contacts. Measuring how we meet each other helps understand and predict flu epidemics. Think about the all people you met yesterday and where you met them.
How many people did you have conversational contact with yesterday (talking face to face)?
question.description: Why are we asking this? To find out whether people who have many contacts (perhaps with certain age groups) are more likely to experience symptoms. How should I answer it? Only record people in one setting. So if you saw someone at work and socialising, then only record them in the place where you spent most time together. “Home” means your home. “Work” means you place(s) of work (or school for younger participants). Anyone you have had a conversational contact AND a physical contact with should be recorded both here and in the next question – i.e. they should be included twice.

question.title: How many people did you have physical contact with yesterday (skin-to-skin contact, e.g. handshake, kiss)?
question.description: Why are we asking this? Illnesses might be spread via touch (e.g. when shaking hands). How should I answer it? Only record people in one setting. So if you saw someone at work and socialising, then only record them in the place where you spent most time together. “Home” means your home. “Work” means you place(s) of work (or school for younger participants). Anyone you have had a conversational contact AND a physical contact with should be recorded both here and in the previous question – i.e. they should be included twice.

question.title: How much time did you spend on public transport (e.g. bus, train, underground) yesterday?
question.description: Why are we asking this? It has been suggested that using public transport may be a risk for getting flu. We would like to check this. How should I answer it? Don’t include taxis, or other forms of private transport.

question.title: How long did you spend in an enclosed indoor space (e.g. office, classroom, bar, cinema) with more than 10 other people yesterday? (Not including public transport)
question.description: Why are we asking this? Attending busy places is thought to be a risk factor for getting flu .We would like to check this. How should I answer it? Remember not to include time spent on public transport, as we ask this in the previous question.

question.title: What was the furthest distance from home that you travelled yesterday?
question.description: Why are we asking this? To find out how far you travel, and whether there is a link with catching flu. How should I answer it? If you did not leave home, then tick the “under 1 mile” option.

question.title: What was the furthest distance from home that you travelled yesterday?
question.description: Why are we asking this? To find out how far you travel, and whether there is a link with catching flu. How should I answer it? If you did not leave home, then tick the “under 1 km” option.

question.title: Con quante persone circa hai avuto un contatto faccia a faccia ieri?
Con quante persone circa hai avuto un contatto fisico ieri (ad es. strette di mano, baci)?
Quanto tempo circa hai trascorso ieri sui mezzi pubblici (ad es. bus, treno, metropolitana)?
Quanto tempo circa hai trascorso ieri in un ambiente chiuso con più di dieci persone (ad es. in ufficio, in classe, al bar, al cinema)? (Escludendo i mezzi pubblici)
Qual è stata la massima distanza da casa a cui hai viaggiato ieri?

option.text: Non ho usato i mezzi pubblici
Non sono stato in luoghi affollati o con più di dieci persone
